title: Ticket #7652: Manual claims IDTOKENS work on Windows but they don't (yet)
description:
The authentication section of the security page (https://htcondor.readthedocs.io/en/latest/admin-manual/security.html#authentication) provides a list of auth methods and highlights the ones that don't work on Windows, like so: 

  GSI       (not available on Windows platforms)
  SSL
  KERBEROS
  PASSWORD
  FS        (not available on Windows platforms)
  FS_REMOTE (not available on Windows platforms)
  IDTOKENS
  SCITOKENS
  NTSSPI
  MUNGE
  CLAIMTOBE
  ANONYMOUS

IDTOKENS do not currently work on Windows but this list implies that they do. This should be fixed.
remarks:
and NTSSPI doesn't work on linux, the temporary fact that IDTOKENS doesn't work on windows is the least of the problems with that page

2020-Oct-05 12:48:50 by bbockelm:
Oddly, we've had folks submit via IDTOKENS from a Windows machine... do you know concretely what's not working?

2020-Oct-19 15:54:22 by johnkn:
no I don't know that it doesn't work, but Id be surprised if it did since the path the code uses to find the tokens can't exist on Windows
creator: matyas
